## Usage 

 Click on the navigation tree to open the docs

scripts.lint: npm run lint:eslint && npm run lint:prettier
scripts.format: npm run format:eslint && npm run format:prettier

children.payload:
{"description":"`furo-forth-stack` is a declarative stack, inspired by the forth stack.

https://hackaday.com/2017/01/27/forth-the-hackers-language/
http://wiki.laptop.org/go/Forth_stack_operators
http://galileo.phys.virginia.edu/classes/551.jvn.fall01/primer.htm#stacks","summary":"forth like stack","path":"src/furo-forth-stack.js","properties":[{"name":"size","type":"number","description":"Current size of the stack","privacy":"public","sourceRange":{"start":{"line":41,"column":2},"end":{"line":43,"column":3}},"metadata":{"polymer":{"readOnly":false}}}],"methods":[{"name":"clearStack","description":"Empties the stack and set the stack-size to 0","privacy":"public","sourceRange":{"start":{"line":47,"column":2},"end":{"line":50,"column":3}},"metadata":{},"params":[],"return":{"type":"void"}},{"name":"put","description":"Add an element to the stack","privacy":"public","sourceRange":{"start":{"line":57,"column":2},"end":{"line":61,"column":3}},"metadata":{},"params":[{"name":"e"}],"return":{"desc":"Number The actual size of the stack"}},{"name":"swap","description":"swap **( n1 n2 -- n2 n1 )**

swap, as you may have guessed, swaps the top two elements of the stack. For example:

1 2 3 4 swap
will give you:

1 2 4 3 <- Top","privacy":"public","sourceRange":{"start":{"line":75,"column":2},"end":{"line":85,"column":3}},"metadata":{},"params":[],"return":{"type":"void"}},{"name":"drop","description":"drop **( n -- )**

 drop simply drops the top element of the stack. Running:

 1 2 3 drop
 gives you a stack of:

 1 2 <- Top","privacy":"public","sourceRange":{"start":{"line":97,"column":2},"end":{"line":112,"column":3}},"metadata":{},"params":[]},{"name":"dup","description":"dup **( n -- n n )**

    dup is short for “duplicate” – it duplicates the top element of the stack. For example, try this out:

    1 2 3 dup

    You should end up with the following stack:

    1 2 3 3 <- Top","privacy":"public","sourceRange":{"start":{"line":125,"column":2},"end":{"line":129,"column":3}},"metadata":{},"params":[]},{"name":"over","description":"over **( n1 n2 -- n1 n2 n1 )**

   over is a bit less obvious: it takes the second element from the top of the stack and duplicates it to the top of the stack. Running this:

   1 2 3 over
   will result in this:

   1 2 3 2 <- Top","privacy":"public","sourceRange":{"start":{"line":142,"column":2},"end":{"line":146,"column":3}},"metadata":{},"params":[]},{"name":"rot","description":"rot **( n1 n2 n3 -- n2 n3 n1 )**

   Finally, rot “rotates” the top three elements of the stack. The third element from the top of the stack gets moved to the top of the stack, pushing the other two elements down.

   1 2 3 rot
   gives you:

   2 3* 1 <- Top","privacy":"public","sourceRange":{"start":{"line":158,"column":2},"end":{"line":174,"column":3}},"metadata":{},"params":[],"return":{"type":"void"}},{"name":"rrot","description":"rrot **( n1 n2 n3 -- n3 n1 n2 )**

   Reverse rotation or right rotation rrot “rotates” the elements of the stack inverse to rot.
   The top elemen the stack gets moved to the bottom of the stack.

   1 2 3 rot
   gives you:

   2 3* 1 <- Top","privacy":"public","sourceRange":{"start":{"line":187,"column":2},"end":{"line":202,"column":3}},"metadata":{},"params":[],"return":{"type":"void"}},{"name":"_move","description":"moves element of an array from index to index*","privacy":"private","sourceRange":{"start":{"line":211,"column":2},"end":{"line":216,"column":3}},"metadata":{},"params":[{"name":"arr"},{"name":"fromIndex"},{"name":"toIndex"}],"return":{"type":"void"}},{"name":"_notifyStackChange","description":"","privacy":"protected","sourceRange":{"start":{"line":218,"column":2},"end":{"line":228,"column":3}},"metadata":{},"params":[],"return":{"type":"void"}}],"staticMethods":[],"demos":[],"metadata":{},"sourceRange":{"start":{"line":14,"column":7},"end":{"line":229,"column":1}},"privacy":"public","superclass":"LitElement","name":"FuroForthStack","attributes":[],"events":[{"type":"CustomEvent","name":"empty","description":"Fired when stack is empty","metadata":{}},{"type":"CustomEvent","name":"rotated","description":"Fired when stack was rotated","metadata":{}},{"type":"CustomEvent","name":"stack-changed","description":"stack-changed
Fired when the stack contents changes after put, drop,...

detail payload: the top element","metadata":{}},{"type":"CustomEvent","name":"stack-size-changed","description":"stack-size-changed
Fired when the stack size changes
detail payload: {Number} Integer with the current size of the stack","metadata":{}},{"type":"CustomEvent","name":"swapped","description":"Fired when stack was swapped","metadata":{}}],"styling":{"cssVariables":[],"selectors":[]},"slots":[],"tagname":"furo-forth-stack"}
